title: Space Force missile-warning satellites drawing congressional attention
summary: Strategic communications and missile warning satellites “represent a fundamental departure from how DoD has historically carried out these critical missions,” says a new report by the Aerospace Corp. published June 22.

title: NASA opens Earth Information Center amid budget uncertainty
summary: NASA inaugurated a public center designed to highlight the information provided by its fleet of Earth science spacecraft, although future missions face budgetary challenges.

title: ULA’s Delta 4 Heavy launches classified spy satellite
summary: United Launch Alliance launched a classified National Reconnaissance Office spy satellite on a Delta 4 Heavy rocket June 22 at 5:18 a.m. Eastern from Space Launch Complex-37 (SLC-37) at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, Florida.

title: House Armed Services Committee advances 2024 defense policy bill
summary: WASHINGTON — The House Armed Services Committee in a late-night vote June 21 approved its version of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year 2024 by a vote […]

title: CNES Awards Contract to Dark for Space Debris Interceptor Simulation
summary:
French space agency CNES has awarded a contract to space debris removal startup Dark to conduct an emergency space debris interception simulation. The study will focus on assessing Dark’s Interceptor system, which is designed to be rapidly deployed to capture large space debris objects like rocket bodies. The Dark Interceptor is an air-launched rocket that […]
The post CNES Awards Contract to Dark for Space Debris Interceptor Simulation appeared first on European Spaceflight.
